intro: Lilaeopsis schaffneriana subsp. recurva, commonly known as the recurved lily, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to southern Africa, particularly in regions with temperate climates.
